Long Parameter List.description:
Description

Introduction

A Long Parameter List occurs when a method has a lot of parameters.

Example

Given

ruby
class Dummy
  def long_list(foo,bar,baz,fling,flung)
    puts foo,bar,baz,fling,flung
  end
end

Reek would report the following warning:

test.rb -- 1 warning:
  [2]:Dummy#long_list has 5 parameters (LongParameterList)

A common solution to this problem would be the introduction of parameter objects.

Current Support in Reek

Long Parameter List reports any method or block with more than 3 parameters.
Long Parameter List.option:
Reek's Long Parameter List detector supports the
Basic Smell Options, plus:

| Option       | Value   | Effect  |
| -------------|---------|---------|
| max_params | integer | The maximum number of parameters allowed in a method or block before a warning is issued. Defaults to 3. |
